revision.text: CRID registry PubMed and GenBank both have CRID registries as parts of their database systems. A data set that consists of CRIDs (centrally registered identifier) and additional information about their corresponding entities, that were recorded in the dataset through an assigning a centrally registered identifier process. Un ensemble de données composé de CRID (identifiant enregistré centralement) et d'informations supplémentaires sur leurs entités correspondantes, qui ont été enregistrés dans l'ensemble de données par l'attribution d'un processus d'identification centralisé. IAO call, 20101124: PubMed registry is an instance of CRID registry Jean-Marc Meunier PERSON: Alan Ruttenberg PERSON: Bill Hogan PERSON: Bjoern Peters PERSON: Melanie Courtot centrally registered identifier registry Original proposal from Bjoern, discussions at IAO calls is a subclass from http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/IAO_0000100
